          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 21, 2022, 6:01 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<span class="line"><!---->Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<!----></span><br><br>Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<span class="line"><!---->Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<!----></span><br><br>Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<span class="line"><!---->Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<span class="line"><!---->For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<span class="line"><!---->chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<!----></span><br><br><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>void UsbDeviceManager::GetApiDevice(<span class="line"><!---->void the guid<span class="line"><!---->  device_out-&gt;device = GetIdFromGuid(device_in.guid); // &lt; --lazily create an entry for the guid<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/usb/usb_device_manager.h;l=121;drc=3decef66bc4c08b142a19db9628e9efe68973e64<a class="undefined"         Requesting merge to dev M110 because latest trunk commit (1087179) appears to be after dev branch point (1084008).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to dev M110 because latest trunk commit (1087179) appears to be after dev branch point (1084008).<!----></span><br><br>Thank you for fixing this security bug! We aim to ship security fixes as quickly as possible, to limit their opportunity for exploitation as an "n-day" (that is, a bug where git fixes are developed into attacks before those fixes reach users).<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for fixing this security bug! We aim to ship security fixes as quickly as possible, to limit their opportunity for exploitation as an "n-day" (that is, a bug where git fixes are developed into attacks before those fixes reach users).<!----></span><br><br>Sheriffbot has determined this fix is necessary on milestone(s): [].<span class="line"><!---->Sheriffbot has determined this fix is necessary on milestone(s): [].<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<span class="line"><!---->1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<!----></span><br>2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<span class="line"><!---->2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<!----></span><br>3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<!----></span><br>4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<!----></span><br>5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->5. Does it require manual verification by the test team?           -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-2000
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>

        <tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Summary<!----></th>
            <!---->
          </tr>

          
        </tbody><table><tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <!---->

        Description #1 by undoi...@gmail.com (Dec 17, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by undoi...@gmail.com (Dec 17, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When choosing Hid devices in the page created by extension, heap buffer overflow occurs. <span class="line"><!---->When choosing Hid devices in the page created by extension, heap buffer overflow occurs. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version:111.0.5483.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version:111.0.5483.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System:Windows 10 19045<span class="line"><!---->Operating System:Windows 10 19045<!----></span><br>tested on <span class="line"><!---->tested on <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. download chromium version from above link, and install extension according to uploaded files, an app window will be created by the extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. download chromium version from above link, and install extension according to uploaded files, an app window will be created by the extension.<!----></span><br>2. click scan button on the app window, chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() function in main.js will be called.<span class="line"><!---->2. click scan button on the app window, chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() function in main.js will be called.<!----></span><br>3. after scan result shows, choosing a device in the list, and click "select" button, OOB occurs.<span class="line"><!---->3. after scan result shows, choosing a device in the list, and click "select" button, OOB occurs.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL         I reproduced the crash in physical machine,  and I reproduced the bug on a virtual machine too. The problem I encountered on virtual machine was when I click "Scan", the result list of devices will show nothing(see in picture1). And I passthrough a device(eg, keyboard) into the virtual machine, the result shows correctly(see in picture 2).<span class="line"><!---->I reproduced the crash in physical machine,  and I reproduced the bug on a virtual machine too. The problem I encountered on virtual machine was when I click "Scan", the result list of devices will show nothing(see in picture1). And I passthrough a device(eg, keyboard) into the virtual machine, the result shows correctly(see in picture 2).<!----></span><br><br>If your virtual machine runs on VMware Workstation, you can refer the following link to passthrough the hid device into the virtual machine.<span class="line"><!---->If your virtual machine runs on VMware Workstation, you can refer the following link to passthrough the hid device into the virtual machine.<!----></span><br>https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/"><!---->https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/<!----></a><br><br>The video records the process of reproducing the bug on vm, hope that will be helpful for you.<span class="line"><!---->The video records the process of reproducing the bug on vm, hope that will be helpful for you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Please use external keyboard or mouse when reproducing this bug.         The reason for hitting the DCHECK[1] is due to the extensions::HidDeviceManager in the flow of directly invoking chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices won't properly call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() and the internal tracking structure resource_id_[2] isn't synced with the device shown to the chooser. So it ended up hitting [1]<span class="line"><!---->The reason for hitting the DCHECK[1] is due to the extensions::HidDeviceManager in the flow of directly invoking chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices won't properly call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() and the internal tracking structure resource_id_[2] isn't synced with the device shown to the chooser. So it ended up hitting [1]<!----></span><br><br>I will look further to see where the HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() should be called and how to make sure resource_id_ is synced in the scenario of using chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices<span class="line"><!---->I will look further to see where the HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() should be called and how to make sure resource_id_ is synced in the scenario of using chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 21, 2022, 6:01 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 21, 2022, 6:01 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<span class="line"><!---->Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<!----></span><br><br>Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<span class="line"><!---->Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<!----></span><br><br>Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<span class="line"><!---->Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

        This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression.         For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<span class="line"><!---->For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<span class="line"><!---->chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<!----></span><br><br><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>void UsbDeviceManager::GetApiDevice(<span class="line"><!---->void the guid<span class="line"><!---->  device_out-&gt;device = GetIdFromGuid(device_in.guid); // &lt; --lazily create an entry for the guid<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1402000: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in HidDeviceManager::GetApiDevicesFromList
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1402000: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in HidDeviceManager::GetApiDevicesFromList
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      undoi...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/215624548" title="undoi...@gmail.com"><!---->undoi...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      undoi...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->undoi...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When choosing Hid devices in the page created by extension, heap buffer overflow occurs. <span class="line"><!---->When choosing Hid devices in the page created by extension, heap buffer overflow occurs. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version:111.0.5483.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version:111.0.5483.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System:Windows 10 19045<span class="line"><!---->Operating System:Windows 10 19045<!----></span><br>tested on <span class="line"><!---->tested on <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. download chromium version from above link, and install extension according to uploaded files, an app window will be created by the extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. download chromium version from above link, and install extension according to uploaded files, an app window will be created by the extension.<!----></span><br>2. click scan button on the app window, chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() function in main.js will be called.<span class="line"><!---->2. click scan button on the app window, chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() function in main.js will be called.<!----></span><br>3. after scan result shows, choosing a device in the list, and click "select" button, OOB occurs.<span class="line"><!---->3. after scan result shows, choosing a device in the list, and click "select" button, OOB occurs.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash:browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash:browser<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

        I reproduced the crash in physical machine,  and I reproduced the bug on a virtual machine too. The problem I encountered on virtual machine was when I click "Scan", the result list of devices will show nothing(see in picture1). And I passthrough a device(eg, keyboard) into the virtual machine, the result shows correctly(see in picture 2).<span class="line"><!---->I reproduced the crash in physical machine,  and I reproduced the bug on a virtual machine too. The problem I encountered on virtual machine was when I click "Scan", the result list of devices will show nothing(see in picture1). And I passthrough a device(eg, keyboard) into the virtual machine, the result shows correctly(see in picture 2).<!----></span><br><br>If your virtual machine runs on VMware Workstation, you can refer the following link to passthrough the hid device into the virtual machine.<span class="line"><!---->If your virtual machine runs on VMware Workstation, you can refer the following link to passthrough the hid device into the virtual machine.<!----></span><br>https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/"><!---->https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/<!----></a><br><br>The video records the process of reproducing the bug on vm, hope that will be helpful for you.<span class="line"><!---->The video records the process of reproducing the bug on vm, hope that will be helpful for you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
            
      
        
          
          picture1.png<b><!---->picture1.png<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->picture1.png<!----></b>
          
        </div>

        Updating the Security_Impact label because the chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() method is only available on dev-channel. We should check however that the same issue doesn't exist with the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() method which is available on stable-channel.<span class="line"><!---->Updating the Security_Impact label because the chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() method is only available on dev-channel.           Comment 21<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      chengweih@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/229523458" title="chengweih@google.com"><!---->chengweih@google.com<!----></a>
      chengweih@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->chengweih@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Wed, Dec 21, 2022, 5:37 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 21, 2022, 5:37 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 21, 2022, 5:37 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 21, 2022, 5:37 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The reason for hitting the DCHECK[1] is due to the extensions::HidDeviceManager in the flow of directly invoking chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices won't properly call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() and the internal tracking structure resource_id_[2] isn't synced with the device shown to the chooser. So it ended up hitting [1]<span class="line"><!---->The reason for hitting the DCHECK[1] is due to the extensions::HidDeviceManager in the flow of directly invoking chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices won't properly call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() and the internal tracking structure resource_id_[2] isn't synced with the device shown to the chooser. So it ended up hitting [1]<!----></span><br><br>I will look further to see where the HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() should be called and how to make sure resource_id_ is synced in the scenario of using chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices<span class="line"><!---->I will look further to see where the HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() should be called and how to make sure resource_id_ is synced in the scenario of using chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<span class="line"><!---->Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<!----></span><br><br>Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<span class="line"><!---->Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<!----></span><br><br>Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<span class="line"><!---->Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<span class="line"><!---->For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<span class="line"><!---->chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<!----></span><br><br><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>void UsbDeviceManager::GetApiDevice(<span class="line"><!---->void the guid<span class="line"><!---->  device_out-&gt;device = GetIdFromGuid(device_in.guid); // &lt; --lazily create an entry for the guid<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/usb/usb_device_manager.h;l=121;drc=3decef66bc4c08b142a19db9628e9efe68973e64<a class="undefined" target="_blank"       </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Hello, this report is labeled reward-topanel meaning that it will be up for assessment for a potential reward by the VRP panel at a forthcoming VRP panel session. This report will be updated accordingly when a decision has been made.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, this report is labeled reward-topanel meaning that it will be up for assessment for a potential reward by the VRP panel at a forthcoming VRP panel session. This report will be updated accordingly when a decision has been made.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1402000: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in HidDeviceManager::GetApiDevicesFromList
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1402000: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in HidDeviceManager::GetApiDevicesFromList
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      undoi...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/215624548" title="undoi...@gmail.com"><!---->undoi...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      undoi...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->undoi...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Sat, Dec 17, 2022, 6:04 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Dec 17, 2022, 6:04 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Dec 17, 2022, 6:04 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1402000: Security: heap-buffer-overflow in HidDeviceManager::GetApiDevicesFromList

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When choosing Hid devices in the page created by extension, heap buffer overflow occurs. <span class="line"><!---->When choosing Hid devices in the page created by extension, heap buffer overflow occurs. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version:111.0.5483.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version:111.0.5483.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System:Windows 10 19045<span class="line"><!---->Operating System:Windows 10 19045<!----></span><br>tested on <span class="line"><!---->tested on <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. download chromium version from above link, and install extension according to uploaded files, an app window will be created by the extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. download chromium version from above link, and install extension according to uploaded files, an app window will be created by the extension.<!----></span><br>2. click scan button on the app window, chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() function in main.js will be called.<span class="line"><!---->2. click scan button on the app window, chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() function in main.js will be called.<!----></span><br>3. after scan result shows, choosing a device in the list, and click "select" button, OOB occurs.<span class="line"><!---->3. after scan result shows, choosing a device in the list, and click "select" button, OOB occurs.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash:browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash:browser<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I reproduced the crash in physical machine,  and I reproduced the bug on a virtual machine too. The problem I encountered on virtual machine was when I click "Scan", the result list of devices will show nothing(see in picture1). And I passthrough a device(eg, keyboard) into the virtual machine, the result shows correctly(see in picture 2).<span class="line"><!---->I reproduced the crash in physical machine,  and I reproduced the bug on a virtual machine too. The problem I encountered on virtual machine was when I click "Scan", the result list of devices will show nothing(see in picture1). And I passthrough a device(eg, keyboard) into the virtual machine, the result shows correctly(see in picture 2).<!----></span><br><br>If your virtual machine runs on VMware Workstation, you can refer the following link to passthrough the hid device into the virtual machine.<span class="line"><!---->If your virtual machine runs on VMware Workstation, you can refer the following link to passthrough the hid device into the virtual machine.<!----></span><br>https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/"><!---->https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/<!----></a><br><br>The video records the process of reproducing the bug on vm, hope that will be helpful for you.<span class="line"><!---->The video records the process of reproducing the bug on vm, hope that will be helpful for you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Updating the Security_Impact label because the chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() method is only available on dev-channel. We should check however that the same issue doesn't exist with the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() method which is available on stable-channel.<span class="line"><!---->Updating the Security_Impact label because the chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() method is only available on dev-channel.         by

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The reason for hitting the DCHECK[1] is due to the extensions::HidDeviceManager in the flow of directly invoking chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices won't properly call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() and the internal tracking structure resource_id_[2] isn't synced with the device shown to the chooser. So it ended up hitting [1]<span class="line"><!---->The reason for hitting the DCHECK[1] is due to the extensions::HidDeviceManager in the flow of directly invoking chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices won't properly call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() and the internal tracking structure resource_id_[2] isn't synced with the device shown to the chooser. So it ended up hitting [1]<!----></span><br><br>I will look further to see where the HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() should be called and how to make sure resource_id_ is synced in the scenario of using chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices<span class="line"><!---->I will look further to see where the HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() should be called and how to make sure resource_id_ is synced in the scenario of using chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 21, 2022, 6:01 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<span class="line"><!---->Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<!----></span><br><br>Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<span class="line"><!---->Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<!----></span><br><br>Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<span class="line"><!---->Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<span class="line"><!---->For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<span class="line"><!---->chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<!----></span><br><br><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>void UsbDeviceManager::GetApiDevice(<span class="line"><!---->void the guid<span class="line"><!---->  device_out-&gt;device = GetIdFromGuid(device_in.guid); // &lt; --lazily create an entry for the guid<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/usb/usb_device_manager.h;l=121;drc=3decef66bc4c08b142a19db9628e9efe68973e64<a class="undefined"         Requesting merge to dev M110 because latest trunk commit (1087179) appears to be after dev branch point (1084008).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to dev M110 because latest trunk commit (1087179) appears to be after dev branch point (1084008).<!----></span><br><br>Thank you for fixing this security bug! We aim to ship security fixes as quickly as possible, to limit their opportunity for exploitation as an "n-day" (that is, a bug where git fixes are developed into attacks before those fixes reach users).<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for fixing this security bug! We aim to ship security fixes as quickly as possible, to limit their opportunity for exploitation as an "n-day" (that is, a bug where git fixes are developed into attacks before those fixes reach users).<!----></span><br><br>Sheriffbot has determined this fix is necessary on milestone(s): [].<span class="line"><!---->Sheriffbot has determined this fix is necessary on milestone(s): [].<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<span class="line"><!---->1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<!----></span><br>2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<span class="line"><!---->2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<!----></span><br>3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<!----></span><br>4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<!----></span><br>5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->5. Does it require manual verification by the test team?           -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-2000
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When choosing Hid devices in the page created by extension, heap buffer overflow occurs. <span class="line"><!---->When choosing Hid devices in the page created by extension, heap buffer overflow occurs. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version:111.0.5483.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version:111.0.5483.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System:Windows 10 19045<span class="line"><!---->Operating System:Windows 10 19045<!----></span><br>tested on <span class="line"><!---->tested on <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/win32-release_x64%2Fasan-win32-release_x64-1084688.zip?generation=1671266526092459&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. download chromium version from above link, and install extension according to uploaded files, an app window will be created by the extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. download chromium version from above link, and install extension according to uploaded files, an app window will be created by the extension.<!----></span><br>2. click scan button on the app window, chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() function in main.js will be called.<span class="line"><!---->2. click scan button on the app window, chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() function in main.js will be called.<!----></span><br>3. after scan result shows, choosing a device in the list, and click "select" button, OOB occurs.<span class="line"><!---->3. after scan result shows, choosing a device in the list, and click "select" button, OOB occurs.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash:browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash:browser<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I reproduced the crash in physical machine,  and I reproduced the bug on a virtual machine too. The problem I encountered on virtual machine was when I click "Scan", the result list of devices will show nothing(see in picture1). And I passthrough a device(eg, keyboard) into the virtual machine, the result shows correctly(see in picture 2).<span class="line"><!---->I reproduced the crash in physical machine,  and I reproduced the bug on a virtual machine too. The problem I encountered on virtual machine was when I click "Scan", the result list of devices will show nothing(see in picture1). And I passthrough a device(eg, keyboard) into the virtual machine, the result shows correctly(see in picture 2).<!----></span><br><br>If your virtual machine runs on VMware Workstation, you can refer the following link to passthrough the hid device into the virtual machine.<span class="line"><!---->If your virtual machine runs on VMware Workstation, you can refer the following link to passthrough the hid device into the virtual machine.<!----></span><br>https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/"><!---->https://linuxhint.com/passthrough-usb-devices-vmware-workstation/<!----></a><br><br>The video records the process of reproducing the bug on vm, hope that will be helpful for you.<span class="line"><!---->The video records the process of reproducing the bug on vm, hope that will be helpful for you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Please use external keyboard or mouse when reproducing this bug. The keyboard or touch pad on laptop itself may not be recognized as hid device, since they are not connected through usb interface.<span class="line"><!---->Please use external keyboard or mouse when reproducing this bug. The keyboard or touch pad on laptop itself may not be recognized as hid device, since they are not connected through usb interface.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The reason for hitting the DCHECK[1] is due to the extensions::HidDeviceManager in the flow of directly invoking chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices won't properly call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() and the internal tracking structure resource_id_[2] isn't synced with the device shown to the chooser. So it ended up hitting [1]<span class="line"><!---->The reason for hitting the DCHECK[1] is due to the extensions::HidDeviceManager in the flow of directly invoking chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices won't properly call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() and the internal tracking structure resource_id_[2] isn't synced with the device shown to the chooser. So it ended up hitting [1]<!----></span><br><br>I will look further to see where the HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() should be called and how to make sure resource_id_ is synced in the scenario of using chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices<span class="line"><!---->I will look further to see where the HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() should be called and how to make sure resource_id_ is synced in the scenario of using chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=156;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/hid/hid_device_manager.cc;l=244;drc=a3cb0e6330f3d54c4737f780326f62e60c4c87f3<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<span class="line"><!---->Even if we call HidDeviceManager::LazyInitialize() it might be possible for resource_ids_ to get out of sync with the value that is returned from the prompt because HidDevicePermissionsPrompt is talking directly to the HidManager Mojo service rather than getting device information through HidDeviceManager.<!----></span><br><br>Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<span class="line"><!---->Looking at the USB version of this it looks like UsbDevicePermissionsPrompt implements extensions::UsbDeviceManager::Observer and so I'm guessing that the chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices() API won't have this same problem, though I would appreciate you checking just in case.<!----></span><br><br>Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<span class="line"><!---->Given that the chrome.hid API is deprecated as part of the Chrome Apps deprecation and we never shipped chrome.hid.getUserSelectedDevices() beyond dev-channel I wonder if it's easier just to remove the code rather than fix it. We aren't likely to ever ship it to stable-channel.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1402000#c27">Comment 27<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 22, 2022, 6:09 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<span class="line"><!---->For USB counterpart concern, I created a USB chrome app top of the HID chrome app, the package can be found in the attachment.<!----></span><br><br>chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<span class="line"><!---->chrome.usb.getUserSelectedDevices doesn't have this issue. It has similar condition that the prompt give it a device UsbDeviceManager isn't aware of, but the way it handle this situation is to lazily create an entry in the internal maps (i.e guid_to_id_map_[1] and id_to_guid_map_[2]).<!----></span><br><br><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>void UsbDeviceManager::GetApiDevice(<span class="line"><!---->void UsbDeviceManager::GetApiDevice(<!----></span><br>    const device::mojom::UsbDeviceInfo& device_in,<span class="line"><!---->    const device::mojom::UsbDeviceInfo&amp; device_in,<!----></span><br>    api::usb::Device* device_out) {<span class="line"><!---->    api::usb::Device* device_out) {<!----></span><br>  device_out->device = GetIdFromGuid(device_in.guid); // < --lazily create an entry for the guid<span class="line"><!---->  device_out-&gt;device = GetIdFromGuid(device_in.guid); // &lt; --lazily create an entry for the guid<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/browser/api/usb/usb_device_manager.h;l=121;drc=3decef66bc4c08b142a19db9628e9efe68973e64<a class="undefined"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
